verbose_text: Treatment of ovarian cancer cells with GRO-alpha and IL-8 neutralizing antibodies or ablation of CXCR2 by shRNA gene knockdown, CRISPR / Cas9 gene knockout, or CXCR2 inhibitor SB225002 treatment significantly attenuated TAK1 / NFkappaB signaling and decreased in vitro and in vivo oncogenic and metastatic potential, suggesting CXCR2 plays a key role in the GRO-alpha and IL-8-governed metastatic spreading of ovarian cancer cells in the intraperitoneal cavity.
evidence: CXCR2 by shRNA gene knockdown, CRISPR/Cas9 gene knockout, or CXCR2 inhibitor SB225002 treatment significantly attenuated TAK1/NFkappaB signaling and decreased in vitro and in vivo oncogenic and metastatic potential, suggesting CXCR2 plays a key role in the GRO-alpha
